newsitem.title: UK: Telewest looks forward to digital dividend.
newsitem.headline: Telewest looks forward to digital dividend.

text.p: UK cable operator Telewest Plc expects the move to 200-channel digital TV to boost take up of its services, the company said on Thursday.
"Looking forward, we anticipate that new service offerings, especially digital, will have a positive impact on customer growth and revenues," chief executive Stephen Davidson said in a statement.
Telewest has been overshadowed in recent months by the formation of the giant Cable and Wireless Communications (CWC) , created from the merger of four cable telephone and television companies.
Telewest finance director Charles Burdick denied that the move made it imperative for his company to come up with its own alliance.
"We're under no strategic pressure to do anything," he told Reuters in a telephone interview, adding that Telewest was large enough to go it alone.
The company, in which Tele-Communications Inc and US West Inc are major shareholders, reported first quarter losses before tax of 69.5 million stg, a 30 percent increase on the period a year ago.
Burdick said the losses were in line with expectations as the company continued to extend its network, which is now 68 percent built.
The finance director said Telewest and CWC were coordinating plans on the introduction of digital cable.

Telewest said it would be ready to launch the new service with as many as 150 channels of programming plus interactive services in the autumn. Burdick said Telewest's network could be "fine tuned" for digital at a cost of around 20 million stg.
